alert.note: Alert for Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 3:47PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Montrose County through 415 PM MDT... At 346 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Naturita, or 34 miles east of La Sal, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Naturita around 355 PM MDT. Nucla around 400 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... Colorado 90 between mile markers 26 and 33. Colorado 141 between mile markers 52 and 69. Colorado 145 between mile markers 111 and 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide
